strengths: Pipeline decomposition is excellent: route.ts orchestrates a clean linear flow through try-invoke -> try-debate -> try-revisions -> try-synthesize with each module having a single responsibility. The applyRevisions extraction to try-revisions.ts (with 5 dedicated tests) resolved the chronic route.ts copy.

Verification infrastructure is mature and well-layered: 174 tests across 14 files covering validators (38 tests), synthesis extractors (25 tests), debate pipeline (12 tests), revisions (5 tests), metrics (9 tests), route handler (14 tests), SSE hook state machine (12 tests), component rendering (3 test files), pMap (5 tests), and a genuine integration test.

TypeScript strict mode with noUncheckedIndexedAccess and noImplicitReturns -- combined with shared type guards (isRecord, isRepoInfo) in type-guards.ts used across try-invoke, try-synthesize, route, and useReviewStream -- provides a robust runtime + compile-time safety net.
weaknesses: CHRONIC (4+ iterations): try-invoke.ts fallback path (lines 331-378) still duplicates validation logic inline instead of importing extractNumber/extractActionItems from try-synthesize.ts. The file already imports extractStringArray (line 5), so there is no architectural barrier.

Five modules with meaningful logic remain untested: try-storage.ts (254 lines), try-prompt.ts (163 lines), rate-limit.ts (81 lines), github.ts (only pMap tested), and panel-serializer.ts (111 lines) -- collectively ~700 lines of untested production code.
The SSESender type is defined in route.ts and imported by library modules -- creating a reverse dependency from lib to the route handler. Should be extracted to a shared types module.

action_items.action: Fix the chronic DRY violation in try-invoke.ts: import extractNumber and extractActionItems from try-synthesize.ts and replace the inline fallback logic at lines 332-378.
action_items.impact: Resolves a 4+ iteration chronic issue, improves architecture score by reducing duplicated validation logic to a single source of truth.

action_items.action: Add tests for github.ts (parseGitHubUrl, selectFiles, getTierLimits), rate-limit.ts (in-memory fallback), try-prompt.ts (buildUserPrompt, buildCrossIterationContext), and panel-serializer.ts (panelToYaml, escapeYaml).
action_items.impact: Covers ~400 lines of untested pure-function code. Would push verification score toward 93+ and test count past 200.

action_items.action: Extract the SSESender type from route.ts into a shared module to eliminate the reverse dependency where library modules import from the route handler.
action_items.impact: Cleans up the dependency graph so library modules never import from app/ layer.

agents.one_line: The pipeline architecture is clean, verification is deep at 174 tests, and the system compounds well -- but the chronic DRY violation in try-invoke.ts fallback is now in its 4th iteration and needs to be resolved.

strengths: npm package is FINALLY published (boardclaude@0.1.0 on npm) -- this resolves the single most critical adoption blocker that persisted across iterations 12-13. The path from discovery to first value is now `npx boardclaude install .`.

The Try It Now flow is a best-in-class product onboarding funnel. HeroTrySection feeds directly into TryPageClient with SSE streaming, per-agent progress dots, debate phase indicators, and a full PanelSynthesisView -- all without install. The user gets their 'aha moment' in under 60 seconds.

The full-stack streaming architecture in usePanelStream.ts is genuinely impressive -- 340 lines of typed useReducer state management handling 12 distinct SSE event types with proper abort handling, type guards, and graceful error recovery. 174 tests validate the entire pipeline.
weaknesses: Board Builder still has NO preview pane -- chronic across 5 iterations. The builder has form inputs and agent cards but no live YAML preview.
No persistent Install CLI button in the global nav header. Users who discover the product via /try or /results have no obvious path to CLI adoption.
The landing page install section still promotes git clone instead of the newly-published npx command. README shows npx as Option 1 but the website promotes the harder path.

action_items.action: Update the install section in messages.ts to use `npx boardclaude install .` as the primary command, matching README Option 1.
action_items.impact: Reduces install friction on the primary discovery surface (boardclaude.com). Directly improves adoption_path.

action_items.action: Add a YAML preview pane to the Board Builder using panelToYaml(toSerializedPanel()) on every state change.
action_items.impact: Resolves chronic 5-iteration issue. Users building custom panels can see their output in real-time.

action_items.action: Add a small 'Install CLI' link to the global nav in layout.tsx.
action_items.impact: Creates a persistent path from any page to CLI adoption.

action_items.action: Update the score progression data to include the full 14-iteration arc.
action_items.impact: Strengthens the narrative by showing sustained improvement over 14 iterations.

agents.one_line: The npm publish resolves the most critical adoption blocker -- with Try It Now for zero-install value and npx for CLI users, the path from discovery to first value is now genuinely excellent, though the website still promotes the harder git clone install.

strengths: The multi-turn agentic tool loop in try-invoke.ts (lines 151-242) is genuinely novel -- agents autonomously decide which files to search and read across up to 5 rounds, creating investigation depth that a single-shot prompt cannot match.

The debate pipeline with divergence-threshold pair selection, bounded score revisions (SCORE_REVISION_BOUND=5), and structured transcript generation creates genuine deliberation where agents can revise positions based on peer challenge.
Model routing is thoughtfully calibrated: Opus for 4 deep-analysis agents with differentiated thinking budgets (thariq=max/20K, others=high/10K), Sonnet for lower-weight agents, Haiku for free tier.
weaknesses: The 400K character BYOK file budget uses roughly 100K tokens -- only ~10% of the 1M context window. For large repos, this significantly limits agent evaluation depth. Chronic issue across 3 iterations.

No use of the Claude Agent SDK Agent Teams primitive for parallel coordination. The custom Promise.allSettled pattern works but Agent Teams would provide built-in coordination and structured inter-agent communication.
Cross-iteration context includes debate topics but reduces exchange text to summaries. Full debate text would let agents build on prior argumentation.

action_items.action: Increase BYOK file budget to 800K-1M chars to leverage the 1M context window. Add progressive file loading with configurable budget parameter.
action_items.impact: Moves opus_usage score from 81 toward 88+ by exercising the 1M context differentiator.

action_items.action: Integrate Claude Agent SDK Agent Teams for parallel agent invocation, replacing custom Promise.allSettled orchestration.
action_items.impact: Improves opus_usage by 5-8 points and ai_innovation by 3-5 points.

action_items.action: Enable Anthropic prompt caching on system prompt and repo content blocks since all 6 agents share identical content.
action_items.impact: Reduces total input token costs by 40-50% per audit.

action_items.action: Pass full debate exchange text into cross-iteration context rather than just topic summaries.
action_items.impact: Agents can build on prior debate reasoning, creating compound learning across iterations.

action_items.action: Add feedback loop where synthesis results inform next iteration agent prompts more deeply.
action_items.impact: Creates genuine compound intelligence where the system gets smarter with each iteration.

agents.one_line: A well-architected multi-agent evaluation system with genuine agentic tool use and a real debate mechanism, held back by chronic underutilization of the 1M context window and absence of SDK Agent Teams.

strengths: Zero `any` types across the entire src/ directory, strict TypeScript config with noUncheckedIndexedAccess and noImplicitReturns. AGENT_COLORS uses `as const satisfies Record<string, string>` -- gold standard for const objects.

The discriminated union reducer in usePanelStream.ts is an exemplary State Reducer pattern -- PanelStreamAction is a proper tagged union with 12 action types, each handled exhaustively. Combined with shared isRecord/isRepoInfo type guards.

Consistent useReducedMotion() usage across ALL animated components (AgentCard, PanelAgentCard, StreamingAgentCard, ScoreProgression, PanelSynthesisView, AgentScoreProgression). Skip-to-content link and proper ARIA attributes throughout.
weaknesses: Async server component pages (ResultsPage, TimelinePage) perform data fetching without Suspense boundaries -- entire page blocks on data fetch rather than streaming progressively. Only /try properly uses Suspense.

The `as Record<string, unknown>` cast after JSON.parse in try-invoke.ts and try-synthesize.ts bypasses validation. A parseToRecord helper combining JSON.parse with isRecord would eliminate these casts.

The try-invoke.ts fallback path (lines 331-378) duplicates score extraction logic. Both branches compute composite scores and build TryAgentResult objects -- could be unified into a shared buildAgentResult function.

action_items.action: Wrap async data-fetching in ResultsPage and TimelinePage with Suspense boundaries for streaming SSR.
action_items.impact: Performance score +3-5 points. Enables granular streaming SSR and reduces perceived load time.

action_items.action: Extract a parseToRecord helper in type-guards.ts combining JSON.parse with isRecord validation. Replace bare casts.
action_items.impact: Code quality +1-2 points. Eliminates unsafe JSON.parse casts.

action_items.action: DRY the try-invoke.ts fallback by extracting a shared buildAgentResultFromRaw function for both paths.
action_items.impact: Patterns +1 point. Reduces code duplication in a critical pipeline path.

agents.one_line: A genuine showcase of modern TypeScript and React patterns -- zero `any` types, exemplary discriminated union reducers, universal reduced-motion support, and shared type guards; the remaining work is Suspense boundaries and eliminating JSON.parse casts.

strengths: TSDoc coverage exploded from 24% (iter-12) to 93% (42/45 types) with @example JSON snippets on every major interface -- PhD-level API documentation that teaches by showing actual data shapes.

Community infrastructure is genuinely complete: LICENSE (MIT), CONTRIBUTING.md, SECURITY.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT, GitHub issue templates, PR template with accessibility checklist, CI workflow, and live deployment at boardclaude.com.

Accessibility is production-grade: skip-to-content link, useReducedMotion in 8 components, 53 aria-* attributes, 18 role assignments, focus-visible throughout, semantic HTML, i18n with dynamic html lang/dir.
weaknesses: text-gray-400 persists in 41 locations (down from 111 in iter-13) -- still needs contrast boost to text-gray-300 for WCAG AA compliance on body text.
No runnable demo project in examples/ -- developers expect a copy-pasteable minimal repo they can clone, audit, fix, and see scores improve in under 5 minutes.
README screenshots exist but don't show before/after improvement -- need a score progression screenshot or animated GIF.

action_items.action: Replace remaining text-gray-400 with text-gray-300 in body text contexts (41 occurrences across 17 files) to meet WCAG AA 4.5:1 contrast minimum.
action_items.impact: Accessibility score +12 points. Composite 91.15 -> 93.45.

action_items.action: Add examples/demo-repo/ with a minimal project that scores ~65, and examples/demo-repo-fixed/ showing the same project at ~85 after /bc:fix.
action_items.impact: Examples score +8 points. Time to value drops from 10+ minutes to under 3.

action_items.action: Add docs/screenshots/progression.png showing score improvement across iterations and embed in README.
action_items.impact: Visual proof of the improvement loop is the product's core value prop.

agents.one_line: The TSDoc transformation is stunning (24% to 93%), community files are genuinely complete, and accessibility is production-grade -- fix the contrast issue and add a runnable demo, and this is A+ developer experience.

strengths: npm package successfully published (0.1.0) with working CLI installer -- critical iter-13 blocker resolved, dramatically improving community accessibility.
i18n is production-grade: 7 locales with 100% translation coverage (203/203 keys), RTL support for Arabic, dynamic lang/dir, and locale persistence. This is global-ready infrastructure.
Community onboarding is exemplary: 4 panel templates, 4 example files, comprehensive contributor docs, clear README narrative that a non-developer can understand in 10 seconds.
weaknesses: aria-live regions only implemented in AgentCard, missing in other dynamic UI areas like /try page where users need status updates during 6-agent evaluations.
Keyboard shortcuts exist but not documented in user-facing README or dashboard UI -- accessibility features hidden from users who need them most.
No automated accessibility testing in CI pipeline (no axe-core, no WCAG validation) -- manual a11y checks are good but automation catches regressions.

action_items.action: Add aria-live='polite' regions to /try page for phase updates and agent status changes.
action_items.impact: Makes online demo usable for screen reader users, expanding community reach.

action_items.action: Document keyboard shortcuts in README and add a visible help modal in the dashboard.
action_items.impact: Makes accessibility features discoverable for power users.

action_items.action: Add axe-core to CI pipeline with automated WCAG 2.1 AA validation.
action_items.impact: Prevents accessibility regressions, demonstrating production-quality standards.

agents.one_line: npm publish resolved, i18n is production-grade with 100% coverage across 7 locales, and community docs are exemplary -- but aria-live coverage and keyboard shortcut documentation need expansion.

top_strengths: npm package published (boardclaude@0.1.0) -- resolves the most critical adoption blocker from iterations 12-13, enabling `npx boardclaude install .` for zero-friction install (Cat, Jason, Ado)
174 tests across 14 files with zero TypeScript errors under strict mode (noUncheckedIndexedAccess, noImplicitReturns) -- verification infrastructure is mature and well-layered (Boris, Lydia)

TSDoc coverage at 93% (42/45 interfaces) with @example snippets, complete community files (CONTRIBUTING, SECURITY, CODE_OF_CONDUCT), and production-grade i18n with 100% coverage across 7 locales (Ado, Jason)
Universal accessibility commitment: useReducedMotion in all animated components, skip-to-content link, aria-live, focus-visible throughout, semantic HTML, RTL support (Lydia, Ado, Jason)
top_weaknesses: CHRONIC (4+ iterations): try-invoke.ts fallback path duplicates validation logic instead of importing shared helpers from try-synthesize.ts (Boris, Lydia)
CHRONIC (5+ iterations): Board Builder has no YAML preview pane -- users configure agents blind without seeing output format (Cat)
CHRONIC (3+ iterations): BYOK file budget at 400K chars uses only ~10% of the 1M context window, limiting evaluation depth on large repos (Thariq)
Missing Suspense boundaries in ResultsPage and TimelinePage -- pages block on full data load instead of streaming progressively (Lydia)
text-gray-400 persists in 41 locations (down from 111) -- still below WCAG AA 4.5:1 contrast for body text (Ado)

divergent_opinions.analysis: Five agents scored composites of 89-91 (STRONG_PASS) while Thariq scored 82.6 (PASS). The gap comes from emergent_behavior (76) and opus_usage (81) -- Thariq sees the system as underutilizing its AI capabilities despite strong engineering fundamentals.

agent_a.position: Highest scorer at 91.15 -- community infrastructure and documentation are genuinely complete, earning STRONG_PASS.

agent_b.position: Lowest scorer at 82.6 -- the system doesn't leverage the 1M context window or Agent SDK primitives, limiting its AI innovation ceiling.

action_items.action: Fix chronic DRY violation in try-invoke.ts: import extractNumber/extractActionItems from try-synthesize.ts and replace inline fallback logic at lines 332-378.
action_items.impact: Resolves a 4+ iteration chronic issue. Single source of truth for validation logic.

action_items.action: Update install section in messages.ts to use `npx boardclaude install .` as primary command since npm package is now published.
action_items.impact: Reduces install friction on boardclaude.com. Website should match README Option 1.

action_items.action: Add Suspense boundaries to ResultsPage and TimelinePage for streaming SSR.
action_items.impact: Enables granular streaming, reduces LCP. Follows Next.js 15 Server Components + Suspense pattern.

action_items.action: Add aria-live='polite' regions to /try page for phase updates and agent status changes.
action_items.impact: Makes the online demo usable for screen reader users.

action_items.action: Replace remaining text-gray-400 with text-gray-300 in body text contexts (41 occurrences) for WCAG AA compliance.
action_items.impact: Meets 4.5:1 contrast minimum. Accessibility score improvement.

action_items.action: Increase BYOK file budget to 800K-1M chars with progressive file loading to leverage the 1M context window.
action_items.impact: Exercises the Opus 1M context differentiator. Enables deeper evaluation of large repos.

action_items.action: Add YAML preview pane to Board Builder using panelToYaml() on state change.
action_items.impact: Resolves chronic 5-iteration issue. Users see output format in real-time.

action_items.action: Add tests for untested modules: github.ts, rate-limit.ts, try-prompt.ts, panel-serializer.ts (~400 lines of untested code).
action_items.impact: Would push test count past 200 and verification toward 93+.

action_items.action: Enable Anthropic prompt caching on system prompt and repo content blocks shared across all 6 agents.
action_items.impact: Reduces total input token costs by 40-50% per audit.

action_items.action: Add runnable demo project in examples/demo-repo/ with before/after showing score improvement from 65 to 85.
action_items.impact: Time to value drops from 10+ minutes to under 3 for new users.

items_resolved: npm package published to npm registry (boardclaude@0.1.0)
TSDoc coverage expanded from ~80% to 93% (42/45 interfaces)
i18n translations completed to 100% coverage (203/203 keys) across all 7 locales
Test count increased from 169 to 174 (5 new tests)
items_introduced: Update website install section to match npm publish
Add Suspense boundaries for streaming SSR
Enable prompt caching for cost reduction

debate.reason: No related criteria pairs exceeded divergence threshold of 15
